str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To break, break in pieces, crush, shatter. From sun and thlao; to dash together, i.e. Shatter.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To crush to powder, scatter like chaff. From likmos, the equivalent of liknon; to winnow, i.e., to triturate.
